intro: Chlamydanthus canescens, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, grayish foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Chlamydanthus canescens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
